form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cruz (for himself, Mr. Budd, and Mr. Sheehy) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to authorize the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to approve a rehabilitation program for certain veterans with service-connected disabilities that include the pursuit of non-degree flight training programs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Authorizing Vocational and Instructional Aviation Training for Eligible Veterans Act of 2025 or the AVIATE Act of 2025.

section.header: Authority of Secretary of Veterans Affair to approve non-degree flight training courses as part of vocational rehabilitation programs for certain veterans with service-connected disabilities

subsection.text: Section 3104(b) of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting (1) before A rehabilitation program;
by striking To the maximum extent practicable and inserting Except as provided under paragraph (2), to the maximum extent practicable; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

Notwithstanding section 3680A(b) of this title, the Secretary may approve a rehabilitation program for a veteran under this chapter that includes the pursuit of a course of flight training other than one given by an educational institution of higher learning for credit toward a standard college degree the veteran is seeking.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall apply with respect to a rehabilitation program approved on or after August 1, 2025.
